title: Understand String Functions
text: String functions are used in SQL to manipulate and format string data. Commonly used string functions include those that convert the case, trim spaces, and concatenate strings.

title: Identifying Common String Functions
text: Which of the following functions is used to convert text to uppercase in SQL?

title: Case Conversion Functions
text: SQL provides functions to convert the case of strings. UPPER() is used to convert any string to uppercase, while LOWER() converts it to lowercase.

title: Trimming Spaces
text: Which SQL function is used to remove spaces at the beginning and end of a string?

title: Useful String Functions
text: Functions like UPPER(), LOWER(), and TRIM() are common for text manipulation in SQL, allowing for text formatting and space management.
